028/** Provide access to the network communication data to / from the Driver Station. */
029public final class DriverStation {
030  /** Number of Joystick Ports. */
031  public static final int kJoystickPorts = 6;
032
033  private static class HALJoystickButtons {
034    public int m_buttons;
035    public byte m_count;
036  }
037
038  private static class HALJoystickAxes {
039    public float[] m_axes;
040    public short m_count;
041
042    HALJoystickAxes(int count) {
043      m_axes = new float[count];
044    }
045  }
046
047  private static class HALJoystickPOVs {
048    public short[] m_povs;
049    public short m_count;
050
051    HALJoystickPOVs(int count) {
052      m_povs = new short[count];
053      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
054        m_povs[i] = -1;
055      }
056    }
057  }
058
059  /** The robot alliance that the robot is a part of. */
060  public enum Alliance {
061    Red,
062    Blue,
063    Invalid
064  }
065
066  public enum MatchType {
067    None,
068    Practice,
069    Qualification,
070    Elimination
071  }
072
073  private static final double JOYSTICK_UNPLUGGED_MESSAGE_INTERVAL = 1.0;
074  private static double m_nextMessageTime;
075
076  private static class DriverStationTask implements Runnable {
077    DriverStationTask() {}
078
079    @Override
080    public void run() {
081      DriverStation.run();
082    }
083  } /* DriverStationTask */
084
085  @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
086  private static class MatchDataSender {
087    NetworkTable table;
088    StringPublisher typeMetadata;
089    StringPublisher gameSpecificMessage;
090    StringPublisher eventName;
091    IntegerPublisher matchNumber;
092    IntegerPublisher replayNumber;
093    IntegerPublisher matchType;
094    BooleanPublisher alliance;
095    IntegerPublisher station;
096    IntegerPublisher controlWord;
097    boolean oldIsRedAlliance = true;
098    int oldStationNumber = 1;
099    String oldEventName = "";
100    String oldGameSpecificMessage = "";
101    int oldMatchNumber;
102    int oldReplayNumber;
103    int oldMatchType;
104    int oldControlWord;
105
106    MatchDataSender() {
107      table = NetworkTableInstance.getDefault().getTable("FMSInfo");
108      typeMetadata = table.getStringTopic(".type").publish();
109      typeMetadata.set("FMSInfo");
110      gameSpecificMessage = table.getStringTopic("GameSpecificMessage").publish();
111      gameSpecificMessage.set("");
112      eventName = table.getStringTopic("EventName").publish();
113      eventName.set("");
114      matchNumber = table.getIntegerTopic("MatchNumber").publish();
115      matchNumber.set(0);
116      replayNumber = table.getIntegerTopic("ReplayNumber").publish();
117      replayNumber.set(0);
118      matchType = table.getIntegerTopic("MatchType").publish();
119      matchType.set(0);
120      alliance = table.getBooleanTopic("IsRedAlliance").publish();
121      alliance.set(true);
122      station = table.getIntegerTopic("StationNumber").publish();
123      station.set(1);
124      controlWord = table.getIntegerTopic("FMSControlData").publish();
125      controlWord.set(0);
126    }
127
128    private void sendMatchData() {
129      AllianceStationID allianceID = HAL.getAllianceStation();
130      boolean isRedAlliance = false;
131      int stationNumber = 1;
132      switch (allianceID) {
133        case Blue1:
134          isRedAlliance = false;
135          stationNumber = 1;
136          break;
137        case Blue2:
138          isRedAlliance = false;
139          stationNumber = 2;
140          break;
141        case Blue3:
142          isRedAlliance = false;
143          stationNumber = 3;
144          break;
145        case Red1:
146          isRedAlliance = true;
147          stationNumber = 1;
148          break;
149        case Red2:
150          isRedAlliance = true;
151          stationNumber = 2;
152          break;
153        default:
154          isRedAlliance = true;
155          stationNumber = 3;
156          break;
157      }
158
159      String currentEventName;
160      String currentGameSpecificMessage;
161      int currentMatchNumber;
162      int currentReplayNumber;
163      int currentMatchType;
164      int currentControlWord;
165      m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
166      try {
167        currentEventName = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.eventName;
168        currentGameSpecificMessage = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.gameSpecificMessage;
169        currentMatchNumber = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.matchNumber;
170        currentReplayNumber = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.replayNumber;
171        currentMatchType = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.matchType;
172      } finally {
173        m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
174      }
175      currentControlWord = HAL.nativeGetControlWord();
176
177      if (oldIsRedAlliance != isRedAlliance) {
178        alliance.set(isRedAlliance);
179        oldIsRedAlliance = isRedAlliance;
180      }
181      if (oldStationNumber != stationNumber) {
182        station.set(stationNumber);
183        oldStationNumber = stationNumber;
184      }
185      if (!oldEventName.equals(currentEventName)) {
186        eventName.set(currentEventName);
187        oldEventName = currentEventName;
188      }
189      if (!oldGameSpecificMessage.equals(currentGameSpecificMessage)) {
190        gameSpecificMessage.set(currentGameSpecificMessage);
191        oldGameSpecificMessage = currentGameSpecificMessage;
192      }
193      if (currentMatchNumber != oldMatchNumber) {
194        matchNumber.set(currentMatchNumber);
195        oldMatchNumber = currentMatchNumber;
196      }
197      if (currentReplayNumber != oldReplayNumber) {
198        replayNumber.set(currentReplayNumber);
199        oldReplayNumber = currentReplayNumber;
200      }
201      if (currentMatchType != oldMatchType) {
202        matchType.set(currentMatchType);
203        oldMatchType = currentMatchType;
204      }
205      if (currentControlWord != oldControlWord) {
206        controlWord.set(currentControlWord);
207        oldControlWord = currentControlWord;
208      }
209    }
210  }
211
212  private static class JoystickLogSender {
213    JoystickLogSender(DataLog log, int stick, long timestamp) {
214      m_stick = stick;
215
216      m_logButtons = new BooleanArrayLogEntry(log, "DS:joystick" + stick + "/buttons", timestamp);
217      m_logAxes = new FloatArrayLogEntry(log, "DS:joystick" + stick + "/axes", timestamp);
218      m_logPOVs = new IntegerArrayLogEntry(log, "DS:joystick" + stick + "/povs", timestamp);
219
220      appendButtons(timestamp);
221      appendAxes(timestamp);
222      appendPOVs(timestamp);
223    }
224
225    public void send(long timestamp) {
226      if (m_joystickButtonsCache[m_stick].m_count != m_joystickButtons[m_stick].m_count
227          || m_joystickButtonsCache[m_stick].m_buttons != m_joystickButtons[m_stick].m_buttons) {
228        appendButtons(timestamp);
229      }
230
231      if (m_joystickAxesCache[m_stick].m_count != m_joystickAxes[m_stick].m_count) {
232        appendAxes(timestamp);
233      } else {
234        int count = m_joystickAxesCache[m_stick].m_count;
235        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
236          if (m_joystickAxesCache[m_stick].m_axes[i] != m_joystickAxes[m_stick].m_axes[i]) {
237            appendAxes(timestamp);
238            break;
239          }
240        }
241      }
242
243      if (m_joystickPOVsCache[m_stick].m_count != m_joystickPOVs[m_stick].m_count) {
244        appendPOVs(timestamp);
245      } else {
246        int count = m_joystickPOVsCache[m_stick].m_count;
247        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
248          if (m_joystickPOVsCache[m_stick].m_povs[i] != m_joystickPOVs[m_stick].m_povs[i]) {
249            appendPOVs(timestamp);
250            break;
251          }
252        }
253      }
254    }
255
256    void appendButtons(long timestamp) {
257      int count = m_joystickButtonsCache[m_stick].m_count;
258      if (m_sizedButtons == null || m_sizedButtons.length != count) {
259        m_sizedButtons = new boolean[count];
260      }
261      int buttons = m_joystickButtonsCache[m_stick].m_buttons;
262      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
263        m_sizedButtons[i] = (buttons & (1 << i)) != 0;
264      }
265      m_logButtons.append(m_sizedButtons, timestamp);
266    }
267
268    void appendAxes(long timestamp) {
269      int count = m_joystickAxesCache[m_stick].m_count;
270      if (m_sizedAxes == null || m_sizedAxes.length != count) {
271        m_sizedAxes = new float[count];
272      }
273      System.arraycopy(m_joystickAxesCache[m_stick].m_axes, 0, m_sizedAxes, 0, count);
274      m_logAxes.append(m_sizedAxes, timestamp);
275    }
276
277    void appendPOVs(long timestamp) {
278      int count = m_joystickPOVsCache[m_stick].m_count;
279      if (m_sizedPOVs == null || m_sizedPOVs.length != count) {
280        m_sizedPOVs = new long[count];
281      }
282      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
283        m_sizedPOVs[i] = m_joystickPOVsCache[m_stick].m_povs[i];
284      }
285      m_logPOVs.append(m_sizedPOVs, timestamp);
286    }
287
288    final int m_stick;
289    boolean[] m_sizedButtons;
290    float[] m_sizedAxes;
291    long[] m_sizedPOVs;
292    final BooleanArrayLogEntry m_logButtons;
293    final FloatArrayLogEntry m_logAxes;
294    final IntegerArrayLogEntry m_logPOVs;
295  }
296
297  private static class DataLogSender {
298    DataLogSender(DataLog log, boolean logJoysticks, long timestamp) {
299      m_logEnabled = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:enabled", timestamp);
300      m_logAutonomous = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:autonomous", timestamp);
301      m_logTest = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:test", timestamp);
302      m_logEstop = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:estop", timestamp);
303
304      // append initial control word values
305      m_wasEnabled = m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
306      m_wasAutonomous = m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous();
307      m_wasTest = m_controlWordCache.getTest();
308      m_wasEstop = m_controlWordCache.getEStop();
309
310      m_logEnabled.append(m_wasEnabled, timestamp);
311      m_logAutonomous.append(m_wasAutonomous, timestamp);
312      m_logTest.append(m_wasTest, timestamp);
313      m_logEstop.append(m_wasEstop, timestamp);
314
315      if (logJoysticks) {
316        m_joysticks = new JoystickLogSender[kJoystickPorts];
317        for (int i = 0; i < kJoystickPorts; i++) {
318          m_joysticks[i] = new JoystickLogSender(log, i, timestamp);
319        }
320      } else {
321        m_joysticks = new JoystickLogSender[0];
322      }
323    }
324
325    public void send(long timestamp) {
326      // append control word value changes
327      boolean enabled = m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
328      if (enabled != m_wasEnabled) {
329        m_logEnabled.append(enabled, timestamp);
330      }
331      m_wasEnabled = enabled;
332
333      boolean autonomous = m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous();
334      if (autonomous != m_wasAutonomous) {
335        m_logAutonomous.append(autonomous, timestamp);
336      }
337      m_wasAutonomous = autonomous;
338
339      boolean test = m_controlWordCache.getTest();
340      if (test != m_wasTest) {
341        m_logTest.append(test, timestamp);
342      }
343      m_wasTest = test;
344
345      boolean estop = m_controlWordCache.getEStop();
346      if (estop != m_wasEstop) {
347        m_logEstop.append(estop, timestamp);
348      }
349      m_wasEstop = estop;
350
351      // append joystick value changes
352      for (JoystickLogSender joystick : m_joysticks) {
353        joystick.send(timestamp);
354      }
355    }
356
357    boolean m_wasEnabled;
358    boolean m_wasAutonomous;
359    boolean m_wasTest;
360    boolean m_wasEstop;
361    final BooleanLogEntry m_logEnabled;
362    final BooleanLogEntry m_logAutonomous;
363    final BooleanLogEntry m_logTest;
364    final BooleanLogEntry m_logEstop;
365
366    final JoystickLogSender[] m_joysticks;
367  }
368
369  // Joystick User Data
370  private static HALJoystickAxes[] m_joystickAxes = new HALJoystickAxes[kJoystickPorts];
371  private static HALJoystickPOVs[] m_joystickPOVs = new HALJoystickPOVs[kJoystickPorts];
372  private static HALJoystickButtons[] m_joystickButtons = new HALJoystickButtons[kJoystickPorts];
373  private static MatchInfoData m_matchInfo = new MatchInfoData();
374
375  // Joystick Cached Data
376  private static HALJoystickAxes[] m_joystickAxesCache = new HALJoystickAxes[kJoystickPorts];
377  private static HALJoystickPOVs[] m_joystickPOVsCache = new HALJoystickPOVs[kJoystickPorts];
378  private static HALJoystickButtons[] m_joystickButtonsCache =
379      new HALJoystickButtons[kJoystickPorts];
380  private static MatchInfoData m_matchInfoCache = new MatchInfoData();
381
382  // Joystick button rising/falling edge flags
383  private static int[] m_joystickButtonsPressed = new int[kJoystickPorts];
384  private static int[] m_joystickButtonsReleased = new int[kJoystickPorts];
385
386  // preallocated byte buffer for button count
387  private static final ByteBuffer m_buttonCountBuffer = ByteBuffer.allocateDirect(1);
388
389  private static final MatchDataSender m_matchDataSender;
390  private static DataLogSender m_dataLogSender;
391
392  // Internal Driver Station thread
393  private static Thread m_thread;
394
395  private static volatile boolean m_threadKeepAlive = true;
396
397  private static final ReentrantLock m_cacheDataMutex = new ReentrantLock();
398
399  private static final Lock m_waitForDataMutex;
400  private static final Condition m_waitForDataCond;
401  private static int m_waitForDataCount;
402  private static final ThreadLocal<Integer> m_lastCount = ThreadLocal.withInitial(() -> 0);
403
404  private static boolean m_silenceJoystickWarning;
405
406  // Robot state status variables
407  private static boolean m_userInDisabled;
408  private static boolean m_userInAutonomous;
409  private static boolean m_userInTeleop;
410  private static boolean m_userInTest;
411
412  // Control word variables
413  private static final ReentrantLock m_controlWordMutex = new ReentrantLock();
414  private static final ControlWord m_controlWordCache;
415  private static long m_lastControlWordUpdate;
416
417  /**
418   * DriverStation constructor.
419   *
420   * <p>The single DriverStation instance is created statically with the instance static member
421   * variable.
422   */
423  private DriverStation() {}
424
425  static {
426    HAL.initialize(500, 0);
427    m_waitForDataCount = 0;
428    m_waitForDataMutex = new ReentrantLock();
429    m_waitForDataCond = m_waitForDataMutex.newCondition();
430
431    for (int i = 0; i < kJoystickPorts; i++) {
432      m_joystickButtons[i] = new HALJoystickButtons();
433      m_joystickAxes[i] = new HALJoystickAxes(HAL.kMaxJoystickAxes);
434      m_joystickPOVs[i] = new HALJoystickPOVs(HAL.kMaxJoystickPOVs);
435
436      m_joystickButtonsCache[i] = new HALJoystickButtons();
437      m_joystickAxesCache[i] = new HALJoystickAxes(HAL.kMaxJoystickAxes);
438      m_joystickPOVsCache[i] = new HALJoystickPOVs(HAL.kMaxJoystickPOVs);
439    }
440
441    m_controlWordCache = new ControlWord();
442    m_lastControlWordUpdate = 0;
443
444    m_matchDataSender = new MatchDataSender();
445
446    m_thread = new Thread(new DriverStationTask(), "FRCDriverStation");
447    m_thread.setPriority((Thread.NORM_PRIORITY + Thread.MAX_PRIORITY) / 2);
448
449    m_thread.start();
450  }
451
452  /** Kill the thread. */
453  public static synchronized void release() {
454    m_threadKeepAlive = false;
455    if (m_thread != null) {
456      try {
457        m_thread.join();
458      } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
459        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
460      }
461      m_thread = null;
462    }
463  }
464
465  /**
466   * Report error to Driver Station. Optionally appends Stack trace to error message.
467   *
468   * @param error The error to report.
469   * @param printTrace If true, append stack trace to error string
470   */
471  public static void reportError(String error, boolean printTrace) {
472    reportErrorImpl(true, 1, error, printTrace);
473  }
474
475  /**
476   * Report error to Driver Station. Appends provided stack trace to error message.
477   *
478   * @param error The error to report.
479   * @param stackTrace The stack trace to append
480   */
481  public static void reportError(String error, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
482    reportErrorImpl(true, 1, error, stackTrace);
483  }
484
485  /**
486   * Report warning to Driver Station. Optionally appends Stack trace to warning message.
487   *
488   * @param warning The warning to report.
489   * @param printTrace If true, append stack trace to warning string
490   */
491  public static void reportWarning(String warning, boolean printTrace) {
492    reportErrorImpl(false, 1, warning, printTrace);
493  }
494
495  /**
496   * Report warning to Driver Station. Appends provided stack trace to warning message.
497   *
498   * @param warning The warning to report.
499   * @param stackTrace The stack trace to append
500   */
501  public static void reportWarning(String warning, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
502    reportErrorImpl(false, 1, warning, stackTrace);
503  }
504
505  private static void reportErrorImpl(boolean isError, int code, String error, boolean printTrace) {
506    reportErrorImpl(isError, code, error, printTrace, Thread.currentThread().getStackTrace(), 3);
507  }
508
509  private static void reportErrorImpl(
510      boolean isError, int code, String error, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
511    reportErrorImpl(isError, code, error, true, stackTrace, 0);
512  }
513
514  private static void reportErrorImpl(
515      boolean isError,
516      int code,
517      String error,
518      boolean printTrace,
519      StackTraceElement[] stackTrace,
520      int stackTraceFirst) {
521    String locString;
522    if (stackTrace.length >= stackTraceFirst + 1) {
523      locString = stackTrace[stackTraceFirst].toString();
524    } else {
525      locString = "";
526    }
527    StringBuilder traceString = new StringBuilder();
528    if (printTrace) {
529      boolean haveLoc = false;
530      for (int i = stackTraceFirst; i < stackTrace.length; i++) {
531        String loc = stackTrace[i].toString();
532        traceString.append("\tat ").append(loc).append('\n');
533        // get first user function
534        if (!haveLoc && !loc.startsWith("edu.wpi.first")) {
535          locString = loc;
536          haveLoc = true;
537        }
538      }
539    }
540    HAL.sendError(isError, code, false, error, locString, traceString.toString(), true);
541  }
542
543  /**
544   * The state of one joystick button. Button indexes begin at 1.
545   *
546   * @param stick The joystick to read.
547   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
548   * @return The state of the joystick button.
549   */
550  public static boolean getStickButton(final int stick, final int button) {
551    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
552      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
553    }
554    if (button <= 0) {
555      reportJoystickUnpluggedError("Button indexes begin at 1 in WPILib for C++ and Java\n");
556      return false;
557    }
558
559    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
560    try {
561      if (button <= m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count) {
562        return (m_joystickButtons[stick].m_buttons & 1 << (button - 1)) != 0;
563      }
564    } finally {
565      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
566    }
567
568    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
569        "Joystick Button "
570            + button
571            + " on port "
572            + stick
573            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
574    return false;
575  }
576
577  /**
578   * Whether one joystick button was pressed since the last check. Button indexes begin at 1.
579   *
580   * @param stick The joystick to read.
581   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
582   * @return Whether the joystick button was pressed since the last check.
583   */
584  public static boolean getStickButtonPressed(final int stick, final int button) {
585    if (button <= 0) {
586      reportJoystickUnpluggedError("Button indexes begin at 1 in WPILib for C++ and Java\n");
587      return false;
588    }
589    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
590      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
591    }
592
593    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
594    try {
595      if (button <= m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count) {
596        // If button was pressed, clear flag and return true
597        if ((m_joystickButtonsPressed[stick] & 1 << (button - 1)) != 0) {
598          m_joystickButtonsPressed[stick] &= ~(1 << (button - 1));
599          return true;
600        } else {
601          return false;
602        }
603      }
604    } finally {
605      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
606    }
607
608    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
609        "Joystick Button "
610            + button
611            + " on port "
612            + stick
613            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
614    return false;
615  }
616
617  /**
618   * Whether one joystick button was released since the last check. Button indexes begin at 1.
619   *
620   * @param stick The joystick to read.
621   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
622   * @return Whether the joystick button was released since the last check.
623   */
624  public static boolean getStickButtonReleased(final int stick, final int button) {
625    if (button <= 0) {
626      reportJoystickUnpluggedError("Button indexes begin at 1 in WPILib for C++ and Java\n");
627      return false;
628    }
629    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
630      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
631    }
632
633    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
634    try {
635      if (button <= m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count) {
636        // If button was released, clear flag and return true
637        if ((m_joystickButtonsReleased[stick] & 1 << (button - 1)) != 0) {
638          m_joystickButtonsReleased[stick] &= ~(1 << (button - 1));
639          return true;
640        } else {
641          return false;
642        }
643      }
644    } finally {
645      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
646    }
647
648    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
649        "Joystick Button "
650            + button
651            + " on port "
652            + stick
653            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
654    return false;
655  }
656
657  /**
658   * Get the value of the axis on a joystick. This depends on the mapping of the joystick connected
659   * to the specified port.
660   *
661   * @param stick The joystick to read.
662   * @param axis The analog axis value to read from the joystick.
663   * @return The value of the axis on the joystick.
664   */
665  public static double getStickAxis(int stick, int axis) {
666    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
667      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
668    }
669    if (axis < 0 || axis >= HAL.kMaxJoystickAxes) {
670      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick axis is out of range");
671    }
672
673    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
674    try {
675      if (axis < m_joystickAxes[stick].m_count) {
676        return m_joystickAxes[stick].m_axes[axis];
677      }
678    } finally {
679      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
680    }
681
682    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
683        "Joystick axis "
684            + axis
685            + " on port "
686            + stick
687            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
688    return 0.0;
689  }
690
691  /**
692   * Get the state of a POV on the joystick.
693   *
694   * @param stick The joystick to read.
695   * @param pov The POV to read.
696   * @return the angle of the POV in degrees, or -1 if the POV is not pressed.
697   */
698  public static int getStickPOV(int stick, int pov) {
699    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
700      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
701    }
702    if (pov < 0 || pov >= HAL.kMaxJoystickPOVs) {
703      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick POV is out of range");
704    }
705
706    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
707    try {
708      if (pov < m_joystickPOVs[stick].m_count) {
709        return m_joystickPOVs[stick].m_povs[pov];
710      }
711    } finally {
712      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
713    }
714
715    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
716        "Joystick POV "
717            + pov
718            + " on port "
719            + stick
720            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
721    return -1;
722  }
723
724  /**
725   * The state of the buttons on the joystick.
726   *
727   * @param stick The joystick to read.
728   * @return The state of the buttons on the joystick.
729   */
730  public static int getStickButtons(final int stick) {
731    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
732      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
733    }
734
735    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
736    try {
737      return m_joystickButtons[stick].m_buttons;
738    } finally {
739      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
740    }
741  }
742
743  /**
744   * Returns the number of axes on a given joystick port.
745   *
746   * @param stick The joystick port number
747   * @return The number of axes on the indicated joystick
748   */
749  public static int getStickAxisCount(int stick) {
750    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
751      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
752    }
753
754    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
755    try {
756      return m_joystickAxes[stick].m_count;
757    } finally {
758      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
759    }
760  }
761
762  /**
763   * Returns the number of POVs on a given joystick port.
764   *
765   * @param stick The joystick port number
766   * @return The number of POVs on the indicated joystick
767   */
768  public static int getStickPOVCount(int stick) {
769    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
770      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
771    }
772
773    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
774    try {
775      return m_joystickPOVs[stick].m_count;
776    } finally {
777      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
778    }
779  }
780
781  /**
782   * Gets the number of buttons on a joystick.
783   *
784   * @param stick The joystick port number
785   * @return The number of buttons on the indicated joystick
786   */
787  public static int getStickButtonCount(int stick) {
788    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
789      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
790    }
791
792    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
793    try {
794      return m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count;
795    } finally {
796      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
797    }
798  }
799
800  /**
801   * Gets the value of isXbox on a joystick.
802   *
803   * @param stick The joystick port number
804   * @return A boolean that returns the value of isXbox
805   */
806  public static boolean getJoystickIsXbox(int stick) {
807    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
808      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
809    }
810
811    return HAL.getJoystickIsXbox((byte) stick) == 1;
812  }
813
814  /**
815   * Gets the value of type on a joystick.
816   *
817   * @param stick The joystick port number
818   * @return The value of type
819   */
820  public static int getJoystickType(int stick) {
821    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
822      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
823    }
824
825    return HAL.getJoystickType((byte) stick);
826  }
827
828  /**
829   * Gets the name of the joystick at a port.
830   *
831   * @param stick The joystick port number
832   * @return The value of name
833   */
834  public static String getJoystickName(int stick) {
835    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
836      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
837    }
838
839    return HAL.getJoystickName((byte) stick);
840  }
841
842  /**
843   * Returns the types of Axes on a given joystick port.
844   *
845   * @param stick The joystick port number
846   * @param axis The target axis
847   * @return What type of axis the axis is reporting to be
848   */
849  public static int getJoystickAxisType(int stick, int axis) {
850    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
851      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
852    }
853
854    return HAL.getJoystickAxisType((byte) stick, (byte) axis);
855  }
856
857  /**
858   * Returns if a joystick is connected to the Driver Station.
859   *
860   * <p>This makes a best effort guess by looking at the reported number of axis, buttons, and POVs
861   * attached.
862   *
863   * @param stick The joystick port number
864   * @return true if a joystick is connected
865   */
866  public static boolean isJoystickConnected(int stick) {
867    return getStickAxisCount(stick) > 0
868        || getStickButtonCount(stick) > 0
869        || getStickPOVCount(stick) > 0;
870  }
871
872  /**
873   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be enabled.
874   *
875   * @return True if the robot is enabled, false otherwise.
876   */
877  public static boolean isEnabled() {
878    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
879    try {
880      updateControlWord(false);
881      return m_controlWordCache.getEnabled() && m_controlWordCache.getDSAttached();
882    } finally {
883      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
884    }
885  }
886
887  /**
888   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be disabled.
889   *
890   * @return True if the robot should be disabled, false otherwise.
891   */
892  public static boolean isDisabled() {
893    return !isEnabled();
894  }
895
896  /**
897   * Gets a value indicating whether the Robot is e-stopped.
898   *
899   * @return True if the robot is e-stopped, false otherwise.
900   */
901  public static boolean isEStopped() {
902    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
903    try {
904      updateControlWord(false);
905      return m_controlWordCache.getEStop();
906    } finally {
907      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
908    }
909  }
910
911  /**
912   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
913   * autonomous mode.
914   *
915   * @return True if autonomous mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
916   */
917  public static boolean isAutonomous() {
918    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
919    try {
920      updateControlWord(false);
921      return m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous();
922    } finally {
923      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
924    }
925  }
926
927  /**
928   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
929   * autonomous mode and enabled.
930   *
931   * @return True if autonomous should be set and the robot should be enabled.
932   */
933  public static boolean isAutonomousEnabled() {
934    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
935    try {
936      updateControlWord(false);
937      return m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous() && m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
938    } finally {
939      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
940    }
941  }
942
943  /**
944   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
945   * operator-controlled mode.
946   *
947   * @return True if operator-controlled mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
948   */
949  public static boolean isTeleop() {
950    return !(isAutonomous() || isTest());
951  }
952
953  /**
954   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
955   * operator-controller mode and enabled.
956   *
957   * @return True if operator-controlled mode should be set and the robot should be enabled.
958   */
959  public static boolean isTeleopEnabled() {
960    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
961    try {
962      updateControlWord(false);
963      return !m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous()
964          && !m_controlWordCache.getTest()
965          && m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
966    } finally {
967      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
968    }
969  }
970
971  /**
972   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in test
973   * mode.
974   *
975   * @return True if test mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
976   */
977  public static boolean isTest() {
978    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
979    try {
980      updateControlWord(false);
981      return m_controlWordCache.getTest();
982    } finally {
983      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
984    }
985  }
986
987  /**
988   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station is attached.
989   *
990   * @return True if Driver Station is attached, false otherwise.
991   */
992  public static boolean isDSAttached() {
993    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
994    try {
995      updateControlWord(false);
996      return m_controlWordCache.getDSAttached();
997    } finally {
998      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
999    }
1000  }
1001
1002  /**
1003   * Gets if a new control packet from the driver station arrived since the last time this function
1004   * was called.
1005   *
1006   * @return True if the control data has been updated since the last call.
1007   */
1008  public static boolean isNewControlData() {
1009    m_waitForDataMutex.lock();
1010    try {
1011      int currentCount = m_waitForDataCount;
1012      if (m_lastCount.get() != currentCount) {
1013        m_lastCount.set(currentCount);
1014        return true;
1015      }
1016    } finally {
1017      m_waitForDataMutex.unlock();
1018    }
1019    return false;
1020  }
1021
1022  /**
1023   * Gets if the driver station attached to a Field Management System.
1024   *
1025   * @return true if the robot is competing on a field being controlled by a Field Management System
1026   */
1027  public static boolean isFMSAttached() {
1028    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
1029    try {
1030      updateControlWord(false);
1031      return m_controlWordCache.getFMSAttached();
1032    } finally {
1033      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
1034    }
1035  }

1038   * Get the game specific message.
1039   *
1040   * @return the game specific message
1041   */

1043    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1044    try {
1045      return m_matchInfo.gameSpecificMessage;
1046    } finally {
1047      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1048    }
1049  }

1052   * Get the event name.
1053   *
1054   * @return the event name
1055   */
1056  public static String getEventName() {
1057    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1058    try {
1059      return m_matchInfo.eventName;
1060    } finally {
1061      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1062    }
1063  }
1064
1065  /**
1066   * Get the match type.
1067   *
1068   * @return the match type
1069   */
1070  public static MatchType getMatchType() {
1071    int matchType;
1072    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1073    try {
1074      matchType = m_matchInfo.matchType;
1075    } finally {
1076      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1077    }
1078    switch (matchType) {
1079      case 1:
1080        return MatchType.Practice;
1081      case 2:
1082        return MatchType.Qualification;
1083      case 3:
1084        return MatchType.Elimination;
1085      default:
1086        return MatchType.None;
1087    }
1088  }
1089

1091   * Get the match number.
1092   *
1093   * @return the match number
1094   */
1095  public static int getMatchNumber() {
1096    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1097    try {
1098      return m_matchInfo.matchNumber;
1099    } finally {
1100      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1101    }
1102  }

1104  /**
1105   * Get the replay number.
1106   *
1107   * @return the replay number
1108   */
1109  public static int getReplayNumber() {
1110    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1111    try {
1112      return m_matchInfo.replayNumber;
1113    } finally {
1114      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1115    }
1116  }
1117
1118  /**
1119   * Get the current alliance from the FMS.
1120   *
1121   * @return the current alliance
1122   */
1123  public static Alliance getAlliance() {
1124    AllianceStationID allianceStationID = HAL.getAllianceStation();
1125    if (allianceStationID == null) {
1126      return Alliance.Invalid;
1127    }
1128
1129    switch (allianceStationID) {
1130      case Red1:
1131      case Red2:
1132      case Red3:
1133        return Alliance.Red;
1134
1135      case Blue1:
1136      case Blue2:
1137      case Blue3:
1138        return Alliance.Blue;
1139
1140      default:
1141        return Alliance.Invalid;
1142    }
1143  }
1144
1145  /**
1146   * Gets the location of the team's driver station controls.
1147   *
1148   * @return the location of the team's driver station controls: 1, 2, or 3
1149   */
1150  public static int getLocation() {
1151    AllianceStationID allianceStationID = HAL.getAllianceStation();
1152    if (allianceStationID == null) {
1153      return 0;
1154    }
1155    switch (allianceStationID) {
1156      case Red1:
1157      case Blue1:
1158        return 1;
1159
1160      case Red2:
1161      case Blue2:
1162        return 2;
1163
1164      case Blue3:
1165      case Red3:
1166        return 3;
1167
1168      default:
1169        return 0;
1170    }
1171  }
1172
1173  /**
1174   * Wait for new data from the driver station.
1175   *
1176   * <p>Checks if new control data has arrived since the last waitForData call on the current
1177   * thread. If new data has not arrived, returns immediately.
1178   */
1179  public static void waitForData() {
1180    waitForData(0);
1181  }
1182
1183  /**
1184   * Wait for new data or for timeout, which ever comes first. If timeout is 0, wait for new data
1185   * only.
1186   *
1187   * <p>Checks if new control data has arrived since the last waitForData call on the current
1188   * thread. If new data has not arrived, returns immediately.
1189   *
1190   * @param timeoutSeconds The maximum time in seconds to wait.
1191   * @return true if there is new data, otherwise false
1192   */
1193  public static boolean waitForData(double timeoutSeconds) {
1194    long startTimeMicroS = RobotController.getFPGATime();
1195    long timeoutMicroS = (long) (timeoutSeconds * 1e6);
1196    m_waitForDataMutex.lock();
1197    try {
1198      int currentCount = m_waitForDataCount;
1199      if (m_lastCount.get() != currentCount) {
1200        m_lastCount.set(currentCount);
1201        return true;
1202      }
1203      while (m_waitForDataCount == currentCount) {
1204        if (timeoutMicroS > 0) {
1205          long nowMicroS = RobotController.getFPGATime();
1206          if (nowMicroS < startTimeMicroS + timeoutMicroS) {
1207            // We still have time to wait
1208            boolean signaled =
1209                m_waitForDataCond.await(
1210                    startTimeMicroS + timeoutMicroS - nowMicroS, TimeUnit.MICROSECONDS);
1211            if (!signaled) {
1212              // Return false if a timeout happened
1213              return false;
1214            }
1215          } else {
1216            // Time has elapsed.
1217            return false;
1218          }
1219        } else {
1220          m_waitForDataCond.await();
1221        }
1222      }
1223      m_lastCount.set(m_waitForDataCount);
1224      // Return true if we have received a proper signal
1225      return true;
1226    } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
1227      // return false on a thread interrupt
1228      Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1229      return false;
1230    } finally {
1231      m_waitForDataMutex.unlock();
1232    }
1233  }
1234
1235  /**
1236   * Return the approximate match time. The FMS does not send an official match time to the robots,
1237   * but does send an approximate match time. The value will count down the time remaining in the
1238   * current period (auto or teleop). Warning: This is not an official time (so it cannot be used to
1239   * dispute ref calls or guarantee that a function will trigger before the match ends) The Practice
1240   * Match function of the DS approximates the behavior seen on the field.
1241   *
1242   * @return Time remaining in current match period (auto or teleop) in seconds
1243   */
1244  public static double getMatchTime() {
1245    return HAL.getMatchTime();
1246  }
1247
1248  /**
1249   * Only to be used to tell the Driver Station what code you claim to be executing for diagnostic
1250   * purposes only.
1251   *
1252   * @param entering If true, starting disabled code; if false, leaving disabled code
1253   */
1254  public static void inDisabled(boolean entering) {
1255    m_userInDisabled = entering;
1256  }
1257
1258  /**
1259   * Only to be used to tell the Driver Station what code you claim to be executing for diagnostic
1260   * purposes only.
1261   *
1262   * @param entering If true, starting autonomous code; if false, leaving autonomous code
1263   */
1264  public static void inAutonomous(boolean entering) {
1265    m_userInAutonomous = entering;
1266  }
1267
1268  /**
1269   * Only to be used to tell the Driver Station what code you claim to be executing for diagnostic
1270   * purposes only.
1271   *
1272   * @param entering If true, starting teleop code; if false, leaving teleop code
1273   */
1274  public static void inTeleop(boolean entering) {
1275    m_userInTeleop = entering;
1276  }
1277
1278  /**
1279   * Only to be used to tell the Driver Station what code you claim to be executing for diagnostic
1280   * purposes only.
1281   *
1282   * @param entering If true, starting test code; if false, leaving test code
1283   */
1284  public static void inTest(boolean entering) {
1285    m_userInTest = entering;
1286  }
1287
1288  /** Forces waitForData() to return immediately. */
1289  public static void wakeupWaitForData() {
1290    m_waitForDataMutex.lock();
1291    try {
1292      m_waitForDataCount++;
1293      m_waitForDataCond.signalAll();
1294    } finally {
1295      m_waitForDataMutex.unlock();
1296    }
1297  }
1298
1299  /**
1300   * Allows the user to specify whether they want joystick connection warnings to be printed to the
1301   * console. This setting is ignored when the FMS is connected -- warnings will always be on in
1302   * that scenario.
1303   *
1304   * @param silence Whether warning messages should be silenced.
1305   */
1306  public static void silenceJoystickConnectionWarning(boolean silence) {
1307    m_silenceJoystickWarning = silence;
1308  }
1309
1310  /**
1311   * Returns whether joystick connection warnings are silenced. This will always return false when
1312   * connected to the FMS.
1313   *
1314   * @return Whether joystick connection warnings are silenced.
1315   */
1316  public static boolean isJoystickConnectionWarningSilenced() {
1317    return !isFMSAttached() && m_silenceJoystickWarning;
1318  }
1319
1320  /**
1321   * Copy data from the DS task for the user. If no new data exists, it will just be returned,
1322   * otherwise the data will be copied from the DS polling loop.
1323   */
1324  protected static void getData() {
1325    // Get the status of all of the joysticks
1326    for (byte stick = 0; stick < kJoystickPorts; stick++) {
1327      m_joystickAxesCache[stick].m_count =
1328          HAL.getJoystickAxes(stick, m_joystickAxesCache[stick].m_axes);
1329      m_joystickPOVsCache[stick].m_count =
1330          HAL.getJoystickPOVs(stick, m_joystickPOVsCache[stick].m_povs);
1331      m_joystickButtonsCache[stick].m_buttons = HAL.getJoystickButtons(stick, m_buttonCountBuffer);
1332      m_joystickButtonsCache[stick].m_count = m_buttonCountBuffer.get(0);
1333    }
1334
1335    HAL.getMatchInfo(m_matchInfoCache);
1336
1337    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
1338    try {
1339      // Force a control word update, to make sure the data is the newest.
1340      updateControlWord(true);
1341    } finally {
1342      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
1343    }
1344
1345    DataLogSender dataLogSender;
1346    // lock joystick mutex to swap cache data
1347    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1348    try {
1349      for (int i = 0; i < kJoystickPorts; i++) {
1350        // If buttons weren't pressed and are now, set flags in m_buttonsPressed
1351        m_joystickButtonsPressed[i] |=
1352            ~m_joystickButtons[i].m_buttons & m_joystickButtonsCache[i].m_buttons;
1353
1354        // If buttons were pressed and aren't now, set flags in m_buttonsReleased
1355        m_joystickButtonsReleased[i] |=
1356            m_joystickButtons[i].m_buttons & ~m_joystickButtonsCache[i].m_buttons;
1357      }
1358
1359      // move cache to actual data
1360      HALJoystickAxes[] currentAxes = m_joystickAxes;
1361      m_joystickAxes = m_joystickAxesCache;
1362      m_joystickAxesCache = currentAxes;
1363
1364      HALJoystickButtons[] currentButtons = m_joystickButtons;
1365      m_joystickButtons = m_joystickButtonsCache;
1366      m_joystickButtonsCache = currentButtons;
1367
1368      HALJoystickPOVs[] currentPOVs = m_joystickPOVs;
1369      m_joystickPOVs = m_joystickPOVsCache;
1370      m_joystickPOVsCache = currentPOVs;
1371
1372      MatchInfoData currentInfo = m_matchInfo;
1373      m_matchInfo = m_matchInfoCache;
1374      m_matchInfoCache = currentInfo;
1375
1376      dataLogSender = m_dataLogSender;
1377    } finally {
1378      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1379    }
1380
1381    wakeupWaitForData();
1382    m_matchDataSender.sendMatchData();
1383    if (dataLogSender != null) {
1384      dataLogSender.send(WPIUtilJNI.now());
1385    }
1386  }
1387
1388  /**
1389   * Reports errors related to unplugged joysticks Throttles the errors so that they don't overwhelm
1390   * the DS.
1391   */
1392  private static void reportJoystickUnpluggedError(String message) {
1393    double currentTime = Timer.getFPGATimestamp();
1394    if (currentTime > m_nextMessageTime) {
1395      reportError(message, false);
1396      m_nextMessageTime = currentTime + JOYSTICK_UNPLUGGED_MESSAGE_INTERVAL;
1397    }
1398  }
1399
1400  /**
1401   * Reports errors related to unplugged joysticks Throttles the errors so that they don't overwhelm
1402   * the DS.
1403   */
1404  private static void reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(String message) {
1405    if (isFMSAttached() || !m_silenceJoystickWarning) {
1406      double currentTime = Timer.getFPGATimestamp();
1407      if (currentTime > m_nextMessageTime) {
1408        reportWarning(message, false);
1409        m_nextMessageTime = currentTime + JOYSTICK_UNPLUGGED_MESSAGE_INTERVAL;
1410      }
1411    }
1412  }
1413
1414  /** Provides the service routine for the DS polling m_thread. */
1415  private static void run() {
1416    int safetyCounter = 0;
1417    while (m_threadKeepAlive) {
1418      HAL.waitForDSData();
1419      getData();
1420
1421      if (isDisabled()) {
1422        safetyCounter = 0;
1423      }
1424
1425      safetyCounter++;
1426      if (safetyCounter >= 4) {
1427        MotorSafety.checkMotors();
1428        safetyCounter = 0;
1429      }
1430      if (m_userInDisabled) {
1431        HAL.observeUserProgramDisabled();
1432      }
1433      if (m_userInAutonomous) {
1434        HAL.observeUserProgramAutonomous();
1435      }
1436      if (m_userInTeleop) {
1437        HAL.observeUserProgramTeleop();
1438      }
1439      if (m_userInTest) {
1440        HAL.observeUserProgramTest();
1441      }
1442    }
1443  }
1444
1445  /**
1446   * Forces a control word cache update, and update the passed in control word.
1447   *
1448   * @param word Word to update.
1449   */
1450  public static void updateControlWordFromCache(ControlWord word) {
1451    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
1452    try {
1453      updateControlWord(true);
1454      word.update(m_controlWordCache);
1455    } finally {
1456      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
1457    }
1458  }
1459
1460  /**
1461   * Updates the data in the control word cache. Updates if the force parameter is set, or if 50ms
1462   * have passed since the last update.
1463   *
1464   * <p>Must be called with m_controlWordMutex lock held.
1465   *
1466   * @param force True to force an update to the cache, otherwise update if 50ms have passed.
1467   */
1468  private static void updateControlWord(boolean force) {
1469    long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
1470    if (now - m_lastControlWordUpdate > 50 || force) {
1471      HAL.getControlWord(m_controlWordCache);
1472      m_lastControlWordUpdate = now;
1473    }
1474  }
1475
1476  /**
1477   * Starts logging DriverStation data to data log. Repeated calls are ignored.
1478   *
1479   * @param log data log
1480   * @param logJoysticks if true, log joystick data
1481   */
1482  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.NonThreadSafeSingleton")
1483  public static void startDataLog(DataLog log, boolean logJoysticks) {
1484    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1485    try {
1486      if (m_dataLogSender == null) {
1487        m_dataLogSender = new DataLogSender(log, logJoysticks, WPIUtilJNI.now());
1488      }
1489    } finally {
1490      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1491    }
1492  }
1493
1494  /**
1495   * Starts logging DriverStation data to data log, including joystick data. Repeated calls are
1496   * ignored.
1497   *
1498   * @param log data log
1499   */
1500  public static void startDataLog(DataLog log) {
1501    startDataLog(log, true);
1502  }
1503}
